thread.title: Ryan Kelley, nation's top uncommitted 2017 QB, recaps Oregon Ducks visit
thread.title_full: Ryan Kelley, nation's top uncommitted 2017 QB, recaps Oregon Ducks visit | OregonLive.com

author: Andrew Nemec | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Ryan Kelley, nation's top uncommitted 2017 QB, recaps Oregon Ducks visit
text:
The Oregon Ducks have a dearth of young talent at the quarterback position, but are hoping to address that on the recruiting trail in both the 2016 and 2017 classes.
This year, Oregon already has commitments from ESPN four-star quarterback Terry Wilson and Sheldon High School (Eugene) star Justin Herbert , but is still in search of its signal-caller answer in 2017.
The Ducks made progress in that pursuit this weekend, impressing Ryan Kelley, the nation's top uncommitted quarterback , during an unofficial visit.
"Great visit, amazing coaching staff, phenomenal facilities," he wrote via text message. "All of the players seem like they really enjoy themselves up there. They have a great tradition up there."
Prior to the visit, Kelley was excited about Oregon's pursuit and was anxious to learn more about the school.
"I'm surprised and I'm very stoked about it," he told The Oregonian/OregonLive . "I like everything ‚Äì the atmosphere up there seems great, it seems like they have great fans and I really like their coaching staff with Scott Frost. I just think it's an amazing school."
The 6-foot-2, 170-pound quarterback, out of Basha High School (Chandler, Arizona), is rated as the No. 3 pro-style signal-caller in the country by 247Sports , behind only Tennessee commit Hunter Johnson and Georgia pledge Bailey Hockman.
ESPN rates Kelley as the No. 35 prospect in the nation , nearly 30 spots higher than 247Sports, and has him behind Hockman and Texas A&M pledge Tate Martell.
Adding to the intrigue in the class of 2017 has been the Oregon coaching staff's decision to wait on offering Martell and Marcus Mariota disciple Tua Tagovailoa , both of whom expressed early interest in the Ducks.
Instead, Oregon's first quarterback offer went to Kelley, making him a marquee player to watch in the 2017 recruiting cycle.
